After a couple minutes, I get a message the POP server has timed out. Clicking Account Permission only produces an empty window. I don't get any Sign In display as I've seen in other discussion threads discussing this Oauth problem.

I followed the suggestions mentioned in the 'Automatic Conversion...'as I noted in my initial post above. It states there should be an oauth entry in the Saved Login screens. It is never populated. I presume there's supposed to a transmission back from Gmail Workspace that puts an entry there.

Note the comment in my initial post: 'An idiosyncrasy is I'm the domain administrator for a "Free Legacy Edition of G Suite for personal use".' Google Workspace administrators shut me out of an older version of Microsoft Outlook a couple weeks ago. I've downloaded Thunderbird with its Oauth2 capability to recover my Email functionality.

E secondo te che ne sappiamo noi? Il computer ce l'hai tu... Comunque se vuoi delle risposte concrete dettaglia anzitutto la situazione: Quando Ã¨ successo? Che stavi facendo di preciso? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)

creator: @next

content:
Opening an email does not do anything other than open the email. If a scam email has an attachment, never open it - do not be curious. If email contains any links do not click on them. You can always check a link by hovering over it and the real link is shown in the bottom Status Bar. Thunderbird by default does not allow any 'remote content', so it will not link to anything unless you disable the block on remote content. Emails are safe providing you do not allow remote content and do not open attachments and links.

How to attach an email as either .eml or text file to your own email.

You can 'attach' the email as a .eml to your own email that you are sending. Open a new Write message and enter info etc. Then left click on spam email and hold down to grab and drag over to the 'Write' compose window and it will get added as an attachment when you release the mouse.

Alternatively - if they do not like .eml attachments, right click on spam email and select 'Save as' and then for 'Save as type' choose 'Text files (-.txt, *.text)' Select to save to easy location such as desktop. Then you can use the same method of drag and drop into Write compose email to add as an attachment.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hi David,

Let me clarify...My email address that I use in Thunderbird is a comcast.net account.

I want to delete all incoming messages from gmail that are sent to my comcast.net account.

Does that make sense?

content: For Thunderbird, 'delete' means whatever the account is set to do, which usually is to place in trash folder. That is, it treats it just as any other message that you delete. '

creator: wsmwk

content:
Hi lkiedave.

I believe you are seeing what is labeled as the spring appeal? It doesn't know that you have recently donated. But regardless it should have only appeared once.

What version are you running?

And can you test that your preferences files (prefs.js) is being saved on shutdown. You will find the location at Help > Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Show button. After Thunderbird shutdown should have an update date and time that is current.

If the file isn't being saved, that can be a cause of repeated appeals.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Accounts can be reordered by drag and drop in Account Settings. Folders can be reordered in the latest beta:
